DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Pathologic Quality Criteria Verification CPTAC Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate whether the biospecimen will undergo verification to meet the pathologic quality criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Support or establish by evidence or proof.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Support or establish by evidence or proof.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
Support or establish by evidence or proof.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Tissue from the recurrent, me
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tissue from the recurrent, metastatic or new primary, malignant neoplasm will undergo verification to meet the pathologic quality criteria
